post: Inspire the next generation of citizens and join the Civic Star Challenge! 🎉 Celebrate 250 years of American independence by bringing the ideals of the Declaration of Independence to life in your classroom with the Civic Star Challenge, a nationwide call to K–12 educators to spark meaningful conversations, hands-on learning, and civic action. How to participate: 📘 Engage: Use ready-to-go, flexible lesson plans to teach the Declarations timeless themes. 📸 Share: Submit a simple form to spotlight your students activities. 🏆 Win: Earn the chance to win exciting prizes throughout the school year! Tap the link in bio to sign up now and be the first to hear when the Civic Star Challenge launches in August 2025!  https://lnkd.in/eQsPQWCj 🤝 @icivicsinc  #CivicLearning  #CivicEducation  #Civics  #iCivics

BRI's President, David Bobb, recently appeared on the Dallas-Fort Worth PBS program Perspectives Matter with John Meko, President of Founding Forward. They discussed the current state of civic education in America. Watch this interview to learn how BRI emphasizes the importance of combining foundational civic knowledge with practical citizenship skills that students can develop and apply.  https://bit.ly/43gqGC8

Meet BRIs 2025 Student Fellow, Albert Cai! Albert is a junior at Barrington High School. He's interested in all things politics and government, especially foreign affairs. In his free time, Albert enjoys spending time with friends, going to the gym, and researching for his school debate team, of which he is a captain. Learn more about our Student Fellowship program today!

Empower educators with Pocket Constitutions! These compact guides are essential for illuminating our Constitutional Republic's foundations to future voters and leaders. Check out BRI's newest way to support local civics education! Your donation equips teachers in a state you choose with this vital resource, fostering a deeper understanding of our nation's laws among today's students. Join us in cultivating informed, engaged citizens for tomorrow. Support a Civics Champion today, supply a teacher with Pocket Constitutions!  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #CivicEducation  https://bit.ly/4mp0Epg

Excited to see our very own Amanda, VP of Business Development at Kalogon, featured in the latest Honoring Service episode from the Bill of Rights Institute. 🎧 Tune in to hear Amandas insights and the powerful stories being shared.

In the latest episode of our Honoring Service YouTube series, BRI's Gerald Gangaram discusses civic virtue and responsibility with former Air Force engineer Amanda Krantz. Krantz has served in a variety of positions in the Air Force, at Lockheed Martin Missiles and Space, and with NASA. Currently she is the Vice President of Finance and Business Development at Kalogon, an engineering and manufacturing company that designs seating for customers like wheelchair users, pilots, and drivers. Krantz has always desired to improve peoples lives with technology. Let her story inspire yours!  https://bit.ly/3Sg5MhL

In 1776, a bold Declaration changed the course of history. Now, 250 years later, its time to bring that historyand the power of civicsto life for students across the nation. The Civic Star Challenge is a nationwide call to K–12 educators to spark meaningful conversations, hands-on learning, and civic action. Imagine classrooms across the nation becoming hubs of meaningful conversations and hands-on engagement, connecting your students directly to 250 years of American history and civic activity. How to participate: 📘 Engage: Use ready-to-go, flexible lesson plans to teach the Declarations timeless themes. 📸 Share: Submit a simple form to spotlight your students activities. 🏆 Win: Earn the chance to win exciting prizes throughout the school year! Sign up now and be the first to hear when the Civic Star Challenge launches in August 2025:  https://lnkd.in/eQsPQWCj
The Bill of Rights Institute is committed to honoring the work that teachers do in their communities throughout the year. Join us as we celebrate teachers this month!
